content: गंधः [गंध्-पचाद्यच्] {@--1@} Smell, odour; गंधमाघ्राय चोर्व्याः <ls>Me. 21</ls>; अपघ्नंतो दुरितं हव्यगंधैः <ls>Ś. 4. 7</ls>; <ls>R. 12. 27.</ls> (गंध is changed to गंधि when as the last member of a <ab>Bah.</ab> <ab>comp.</ab> it is preceded by उद्, पूति, सु, सुरभि, or when the compound implies comparison; सुगांधि, सुरभिगंधि, कमलगंधि मुखं; शालिनिर्यासगंधिभिः <ls>R. 1. 38</ls>; आहुति° <ls n="R.">1. 53</ls>; also when गंध is used in the sense of ‘a little’). {@--2@} Smell considered as one of the 24 properties or guṇas of the Vaiśeṣikas; it is a property characteristic of पृथिवी or earth which is defined as गंधवती पृथ्वी <ls>T. S.</ls> {@--3@} The mere smell of anything, a little, a very small quantity; घृतगंधि भोजनं <ls>Sk.</ls> {@--4@} A perfume, any fragrant substance; एषा मया सेविता गंधयुक्तिः <ls>Mk. 8</ls>; <ls>Y. 1. 231</ls>; <ls>Mu. 1. 4.</ls> {@--5@} Sulphur. {@--6@} Pounded sandal wood. {@--7@} Connection, relationship. {@--8@} A neighbour. {@--9@} Pride, arrogance; as in आत्तगंध humbled or mortified. {@--10@} An epithet of Śiva. --धं {@--1@} Smell. {@--2@} Black aloewood.
